thread.title: Sun bear’s ‘holiday’ at resort ends in its capture
thread.title_full: Sun bear’s ‘holiday’ at resort ends in its capture

author: ONG HAN SEAN
title: Sun bear’s ‘holiday’ at resort ends in its capture

organizations.name: department of wildlife and national parks

text:
by ong han sean Unwanted guest: The sun bear pictured in a corridor of the Tembeling Resort in Kuantan. 
KUANTAN: A sun bear, which has been skulking around a resort here for the past month, has been caught. 
Tembeling Resort management officer Helmy Suffian Othman said the adult bear was spotted by security guards at about midnight yesterday. 
“It ran away before being caught in a trap set by Department of Wildlife and National Parks (Perhilitan) personnel at about 1am,” said Helmy. 
The sun bear, which is the size of an adult man, was caught on closed-circuit television cameras wandering the corridors and stairways of the resort several times since late last month. 
Recently, security guards had to chase the bear back to the nearby forest by throwing their batons at it, said Helmy. 
Following complaints of the resort management to the Kuantan Municipal Council and Perhilitan, traps were placed around the area. 
Pahang Perhilitan director Ahmad Azhar Mohammed said the male sun bear would be sent to the National Wildlife Rescue Centre in Sungkai, Perak for quarantine. 
“If it is healthy, we will release it back to a suitable habitat,” he said.
